candidates.title: 2025-01-06: update dependencies
candidates.body:
Hi @chridou,

we want to update our projects to use `axum` in version 0.8. As we use `http-api-problem` in our projects and it has a dependency to `axum-core`, I want to provide a PR with the bumped dependencies 😄 

### Changes:

- update `axum-core` to 0.5.0
- update `hyper` to 1.5
- update `salvo` to 0.75.0
- update `http` to 1.2
- add entry in CHANGELOG.md

I successfully executed the tests with all features.

Best regards 🖖

candidates.title: Update to the latest axum-core version
candidates.body:
https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/releases/tag/axum-core-v0.5.0

No code changes required, tested in a local project.

candidates.title: Update hyper to 1.0
candidates.body: Adjust to breaking changes and fix clippy warnings

candidates.title: Feature/provide PartialEq and Eq derives for the HttpApiProblem struct
candidates.body:
Hi @chridou,

we want to use this crate for our projects and stumbled over a tiny limitation. We need the ability to compare HttpApiProblem structs. 
The current implementation provides a `PartialEq` and `Eq` derive for the testing profile. I suggest providing those two derives in general as this would also make it usable for other use cases.

Changes:

- Move the derives from the test profile to the general availability
- Bump the crate version
- Ensure that the test cases still run successfully
- Document the change in the `Changelog.md`

Looking forward!

candidates.title: Add axum support
candidates.body:
This PR adds support for the `axum` web framework

closes #43

candidates.title: Expose fields mutably and add http::extensions to ApiError
candidates.body:
This PR 

* makes the `fields` of the `ApiError` exposed mutably
* adds `http::extension` to `ApiError` to add typed values to be used with middlewares
* exposes `additional_fields` of `HttpApiProblem` mutably
* fixes some minor issues and warnings

candidates.title: Release 0.53
OpenAPI support via `schemars`
candidates.body:
This PR implements openapi support for `HttpApiProblem`, and, optionally, `OpenApiResponder` support for the `rocket-okapi` crate. In rapidoc, the resulting schema looks like this: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/66472/175251733-05cf0b8a-405d-4a37-8169-123a5f485ebd.png)

I've implemented the schema under a feature flag, under the assumption that you'd prefer to not add dependencies to your clients if they're not intending on using them.

candidates.title: `IntoAPIError` and a derive macro for it
candidates.body:
This PR implements the `IntoApiError` trait and a derive macro for this trait. 

This is for the usecase where clients want to use their own error types, but separately want to convert them into `ApiError` — possibly because the core of the application is written without reference to http, but each independent error can still be translated with reference to http problems and status codes. The derive macro is useful for cases where errors are built from enums of other errors, that already implement `IntoApiError`.

candidates.title: Update to actix-web 4
candidates.body: Actix web has now released version 4, I need to upgrade the version used in this crate for the types to be compatible, no code changes are required though.

candidates.title: Readd stable rocket
candidates.body:
For the last few months, Rocket has been able to compile on stable Rust. Perhaps this would be a good reason to consider re-adding support for it in this library?

I've mostly recycled the old code, adjusting it to the new Rocket API.

candidates.title: 32 fix unused type param
candidates.body:
resolves #32 

- removed the unused type parameter on the `status` method
- bump deps
